definition: surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image
(prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: There are a lot of exaggerations and falsehoods about the Indians.
sentences.chinese: 关于印第安人有著许多不实之辞及谎言。

sentences.english: The white racists tried to keep down the Indians by force.
sentences.chinese: 白人种族主义者企图用武力压服印第安人。

sentences.english: The thankful Pilgrims included the Indians in their harvest celebration.
sentences.chinese: 心存感激的新移民在庆丰收时也邀请了印第安人参加。

sentences.english: One was a print of a Red Indian, given him, he told me, by Catlin;
sentences.chinese: 一件是北美印第安人的花布制品，他说是卡特林送的。

sentences.english: Vargas emptied his tool bag and left the bag with the Indian.
sentences.chinese: 瓦格斯腾出自己的工具袋，把它留给印第安人。

sentences.english: The little Indians were murmuring incantations and showing off their beautiful costumes in jumps.
sentences.chinese: 小印第安人念着口诀，一跳一跳的展示着美丽服装。

sentences.english: Native Americans have lived in the Yellowstone region for at least 11, 000 years.[6]
sentences.chinese: 印第安人已经在黄石地区至少生活了11000年。

sentences.english: Mayan Indian group of central Chiapas in southern Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 南墨西哥恰帕斯中部的马雅印第安人。

sentences.english: I do not learn that the Indians ever troubled themselves to go after it.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道印第安人有没有为了得到食盐，而劳费过心。

sentences.english: Most of the Indians liked and respected him for his honesty.
sentences.chinese: 大多数印第安人因为他的诚实而喜欢并尊敬他。

sentences.english: Whenever old Indian Joe drinks alcohol of any kind, he turns into a psycho.
sentences.chinese: 每当老印第安人乔喝了酒后，他就变得疯狂了。

sentences.english: He always chose to be an Indian and he never lose.
sentences.chinese: 他骄傲地记得自己是长胜的印第安人。

sentences.english: An old Indian gave us a tip about a good place to go fishing.
sentences.chinese: 一位老印第安人告诉我们一个好钓场的秘密消息。

sentences.english: Plains Indians were dependent on buffaloes, and refused to over-hunt them.
sentences.chinese: 平原印第安人都依赖于水牛，并拒绝过追捕他们。

sentences.english: He is Indian, and he’s back here to stay this time.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个印第安人，这次他回到这里是要住下来。

sentences.english: Pathetic attempts to convince oneself of the superiority of anything connected with Indians. Non-Western medicine.
sentences.chinese: 可悲的企图说服自己优势与印第安人有些许的联系。

definition: Maori, indigenous Polynesian people of New Zealand
(Tw) (American) Indian/native American/indigenous peoples of the Americas/also written 印第安[Yin4 di4 an1]
(American) Indian/native American/indigenous peoples of the Americas
the Americas/North and South American continents

pinyin: Ang4 ge2 lu3 Sa1 ke4 xun4
